titleStmt.title: Despatch from Robert S. Newton to Assistant Secretary of State, August 9, 1884

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Despatch from Robert S. Newton to Assistant Secretary of State
Despatches from United States Consuls in St Paul Loanda

div1.p: I have the honor to enclose for the information of the Department, a copy of a statement left me on the 16th of last month by Mr Wesley M Stover, Chairman and William E. Gay, Secretary of the mission established at Bihe in November 1880, a copy of which I have forwarded to his Excellency the Governor General requesting him to make full enquiries unto the matter and do what he can to render them justice as they seem by their reports to have been disgracefully treated through the intrigues of a Portuguese Trader named Braga. Enclosed you will find translation of the Governors reply. Messrs Stover and Fay proceeded for Lisbon bound for America to lay the matter before the Mission of which they are representatives: the remainder of the mission are still at Benguella

I have the honor to be,
Your most Obedient Servant
Robt S. Newton
U.S. Vice Consul

The Assistant Secretary of State
Washington.
